intro_text: It starts snowing soon after the patrol sets out, trying to bring back something, anything, for the fresh-kill pile.
decline_text: They decide to turn back and wait until the snow dies down.

success_outcomes.text: Despite the snow, the patrol manages to hunt successfully, finding mice scurrying along paths worn in through the snow. Only a couple, but in this season, that's more than enough to count as a success. As p_l leads the way home, a sense of security and competence drives them onwards.
Everyone looks admiringly at s_c by the end of the afternoon. Every cat carries something home, but nearly all of it was caught by s_c.

s_c really keeps the patrol on task and motivated through the sharp cold of the leaf-bare morning, not through authority or commands, but with a gentle voice and compassionate understanding that encourages every cat to do their best for c_n.

fail_outcomes.text: The prey must be hiding; the patrol catches nothing. As a snowstorm descends and visibility drops, the patrol clumps together in a dip on the plains, their pelts and tails and legs all tightly wrapped into one indistinguishable kitty cat ball.

The prey must be hiding; the patrol catches nothing. As a snowstorm descends and visibility drops, the patrol clumps together in a dip on the plains, their pelts and tails and legs all tightly wrapped into one indistinguishable kitty cat ball. Still, when they return to camp, r_c is cold and chilled.

history_text.scar: m_c caught a chill while hunting in leaf-bare.

fail_outcomes.text: The prey must be hiding; r_c catches nothing. As a snowstorm descends and visibility drops, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hide/hides} in the mouth of a rabbit warren, shivering and tightly tucked up against the cold. When {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp, r_c is cold and chilled, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paws and tail prickling with the danger of frostbite.

history_text.scar: m_c caught a chill while hunting in leaf-bare.

intro_text: It starts snowing soon after the patrol sets out, trying to bring back something, anything, for the fresh-kill pile.
decline_text: They decide to turn back and wait until the snow dies down.

success_outcomes.text: A storm descends, sudden and violent, putting an end to any other thoughts but survival. The cats retreat under some evergreen shrubs and cuddle together, sharing what little warmth they have. Each cat takes a turn on the most exposed side of the huddle, selflessly risking themselves.

A storm descends, sudden and violent, putting an end to any other thoughts but survival. s_c keeps everyone's spirits up as the patrol hides inside the mouth to an abandoned badger sett, until everyone is talking, shaky and unhappy, but determined not to lose hope.

A storm descends, sudden and violent, putting an end to any other thoughts but survival. As the cats hide from the wind in a stream gully, s_c keeps an eye out for everyone. It's a long couple of hours, but with gentle understanding and compassion the cats make it through safely, closer than ever afterwards.

fail_outcomes.text: A storm descends, sudden and violent, putting an end to any other thoughts but survival. As the cats huddle together, desperately trying to conserve warmth, no one notices that r_c has stopped responding. At some point in the storm, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} life slips away, and {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} distraught Clanmates are left to carry {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} body home.

history_text.reg_death: m_c froze to death while hunting in a storm.

fail_outcomes.text: A storm descends, sudden and violent, putting an end to any other thoughts but survival. When the snowstorm leaves, finally, and the cats trudge back home, but r_c hasn't escaped unscathed, {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} body chilled and refusing to warm up properly.

intro_text: The patrol catches the scent of a red fox. When they track it down, they find it feeding on a pronghorn carcass, either a small doe or one of last newleaf's fawns. It's impossible to say whether the fox killed it or found it.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to quarrel with the fox and to find prey elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol's cats are smaller, but they outnumber the fox, if only by a little, and it's a prize they're willing to fight for. With a prayer to StarClan, they throw themselves into battle, and the fox, already half-full of venison and unwilling to lose blood over it, is driven off from the kill.
s_c shows {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} strength, leading the fight against the fox. By working together and keeping it distracted, the cats harry and harass the fox until it gives up and runs.

The patrol launches into battle, but with so few cats it's exhausting trying to keep the fox and its snapping jaws on the defensive. In an act of daring bravery, s_c darts low to the ground, gets under its snout, and sinks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth into the fox's throat. It's only one bite, but the fox has had enough and flees.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat gained greater trust in one another after successfully driving a fox off from a deer's carcass.
to_cat's daring bravery in a fight against a fox improved from_cat's opinion of {PRONOUN/to_cat/object}.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol fails to drive away the fox, which keeps possession of the food. However, there are no injuries.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat lost faith in each other after failing to drive off a fox together.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol launches into battle, but r_c is caught with a nasty bite, and the cats give up on challenging for the food in favor of quickly helping {PRONOUN/r_c/object} back to the medicine cat den.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a fox fight.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c means well, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} overconfident in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} attack, and the fox manages to sink its teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the wounded s_c.

intro_text: The patrol catches the scent of a fox. Tracking it, they find a swift fox feeding on a cow carcass, either a small female or one of last newleaf's calves. The cat-sized predator definitely didn't kill this massive hunk of fresh-kill.
decline_text: The patrol decides not to quarrel with the fox - bigger predators will be attracted here. Best to leave sooner rather than later.

success_outcomes.text: As the patrol approaches, the swift fox spots them and backs off from the carcass with a whine. The cats can feed in peace for now, but larger predators will surely soon come to throw them off the kill. By cooperating, the patrol is able to at least drag some of the intestines home to camp.

s_c sits and watches the swift fox as the patrol takes over the kill without a fight. It wanders the area, grabbing pieces of gristle and meat and caching them in little holes, giving s_c an idea. Together the Clan cats gnaw off a leg and take their bony prize back to camp for c_n.

While the rest of the patrol feeds on the kill, the swift fox gnawing on the head at the other end in uneasy truce, s_c keeps watch. It turns out to have been a wise move, as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/spot/spots} a cougar's ears sticking up out of the grass. The kill's original owner is coming back, and the cats vacate with speed.

fail_outcomes.text: The swift fox gives up on the kill with a snarl, but a coyote yip in the distance sends both the smaller predator species running, the cats puffed up and unsettled.

The swift fox gives up the kill, but s_c pursues the fox anyway... up until it turns and threatens {PRONOUN/s_c/object} with snapping teeth. s_c calls the rest of the patrol for backup and no one is injured, but by the time they get back to the kill ravens are circling overhead. The patrol gives it up, knowing bigger predators will arrive soon.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a fox. Tracking it, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} a swift fox feeding on a cow carcass, either a small female or one of last newleaf's calves. Roughly equal in size to r_c, the swift fox definitely didn't bring down this feast themselves.
decline_text: r_c decides not to quarrel with the fox - bigger predators will be attracted here. Best to leave sooner rather than later.

success_outcomes.text: r_c approaches the kill, fur puffed up. The swift fox grumbles, but with a hiss both animals agree to disagree, feeding from opposite ends of the calf without further trouble. r_c is able to find some decent scraps to carry back to camp, though being alone, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can't bring back as much meat as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'d like.

Watching the swift fox at the carcass, s_c notices it stripping meat from the calf and caching it in little holes, and starts to copy it. The bigger predators will return to claim the calf soon, but by the time they do s_c will have hidden away the choicest morsels to fetch later.

With great care, aware that the kill's original owner must be somewhere about, s_c snatches the first large scrap {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} and leaves the swift fox to risk the wrath of the bigger predators.

fail_outcomes.text: A coyote yip in the distance sends both the smaller predator species running before r_c can muscle in on the feeding opportunity.

The swift fox gives up the kill, but s_c pursues the fox anyway... up until it turns and threatens {PRONOUN/s_c/object} with snapping teeth. s_c dances out of the way, but hears the caw of ravens descending on the carcass, and knows it would be too dangerous to return.

r_c happily tucks into the massive calf - there's more than enough room for both {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and the small fox to feed. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/hear/hears} a massive, outraged yowl, and a blow from behind sends {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to StarClan with a single hit. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} never saw what did it.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting with a swift fox.
history_text.reg_death: While scavenging alone, m_c was killed by a predator {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} didn't see.

fail_outcomes.text: Puffed up, r_c approaches the swift fox. But there's only one of {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and the fox is {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} equal in size and weight. Instead of running or giving it, it snarls and attacks. r_c gives just as good as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/get/gets}, and both animals end up limping away from the kill.

intro_text: p_l stalks low to the ground, paws soft and light so as to minimize the crunch of snow. Sniffing at every burrow {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/come/comes} across, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} finally {VERB/p_l/discover/discovers} one with a scent from within: ground squirrel!
decline_text: p_l studies the burrow, then shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head. Too much hassle for one scraggly, thin squirrel.

success_outcomes.text: p_l scrabbles at the entrance to the burrow a bit, hoping to dislodge enough earth to flush the squirrel out. It works; it's chittering and angry, but disoriented enough to make for an easy kill.

p_l examines the burrow a bit, before sticking a paw inside and swiping around. It takes a few passes, but {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/hook/hooks} {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} claws into fur and {VERB/p_l/yank/yanks} the squirrel out by the tail, killing it before it can fully wake up.

s_c slowly walks over the burrow, testing {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} steps before stopping at what {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/guess/guesses} to be the midpoint. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/rear/rears} up on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} hind legs and {VERB/s_c/slam/slams} down onto the ground, resulting in an outraged shrieking and scrabbling from within. Quickly hopping back to the entrance, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/wait/waits} overtop to swipe the escaping squirrel up and kill it.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l tries {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} best, but {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} can't flush out or reach the sleeping squirrel.

intro_text: app1 has snuck out of camp alone, hoping to bring something home for the Clan. Running through everything {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'ve/'s} been taught in {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} carefully {VERB/app1/scent/scents} the air and {VERB/app1/strain/strains} {PRONOUN/app1/poss} ears, hoping for any hint of prey.
decline_text: {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} focusing so hard, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/don't/doesn't} notice a Clanmate is standing silently behind {PRONOUN/app1/object}, waiting for {PRONOUN/app1/object} to notice that {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'ve/'s} been caught red-pawed. Oops!

success_outcomes.text: The wind blows a scent towards {PRONOUN/app1/object}, and app1 immediately drops into a crouch. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/track/tracks} it down to a shallow burrow; when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/shimmy/shimmies} {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head and shoulders inside, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/find/finds} a hibernating squirrel! An easy kill, and a good meal for someone at camp.

app1 walks in circles for a bit, and is about to give up and go home, when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} nearly {VERB/app1/trip/trips} over a ground squirrel burrow. A chitter from within gets {PRONOUN/app1/object} excited, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/thrust/thrusts} a paw into the entrance and {VERB/app1/yank/yanks} a squirrel out!

fail_outcomes.text: Unfortunately, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/don't/doesn't} end up finding anything, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/slink/slinks} back to camp empty-pawed.

intro_text: p_l and app1 sit in the plains, near a network of ground squirrel burrows. This is one of a few such networks, rotated around by mentors to teach apprentices their hunting skills. app1 scents the air as instructed, and points out a burrow; sure enough, when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/look/looks} inside, there's a sleeping squirrel!
decline_text: p_l praises {PRONOUN/app1/object} and smiles, but reminds app1 that they aren't there to hunt, just to observe and discuss. There'll be plenty of time another day!

success_outcomes.text: p_l praises {PRONOUN/app1/object} and smiles, and app1 ponders how best to get the squirrel. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/settle/settles} for sticking {PRONOUN/app1/poss} whole head in, just barely able to reach in far enough to snatch it up by the teeth and kill it in the same bite.

p_l praises {PRONOUN/app1/object} and smiles, and app1 ponders how best to get the squirrel. p_l reminds {PRONOUN/app1/object} that they're allowed to work together, and app1 decides to go to the back entrance and screech into the burrow. That wakes the squirrel up, who rushes out and is killed by p_l. app1 looks absolutely thrilled when p_l commends {PRONOUN/app1/poss} thinking and strategy!

fail_outcomes.text: p_l praises {PRONOUN/app1/object} and smiles, and app1 ponders how best to get the squirrel. No amount of {PRONOUN/app1/object} scrabbling or yowling rouses the squirrel, however, nor can {PRONOUN/app1/subject} reach it.

intro_text: The trio gathers around an isolated burrow, discussing their plan in hushed mews. This burrow is an abandoned rabbit's warren, but currently is home to ground squirrels. The three entrances seem just big enough for the apprentices to crawl inside, bringing the hunt right to the squirrels, who should be in the midst of hibernation right now.
decline_text: ... On second thought, maybe this is too risky. app1 and app2 exchange nervous glances, and app3 shuffles {PRONOUN/app3/poss} paws before suggesting they go home instead, to which the others gladly agree. Better to stick to what they know.

success_outcomes.text: Slowly, carefully, the young cats enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. It's easy pickings at that point; the squirrels are awake, and some wriggle past, but when they emerge (covered in dirt and mud), it's with a good haul of squirrels to bring home!

Slowly, carefully, the young cats enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. It's easy pickings at that point; with the squirrels all asleep, the apprentices kill them quietly and without any fuss. It takes two trips for them to bring it all home!

fail_outcomes.text: Slowly, carefully, the young cats enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. Unfortunately, the burrow is barren, not a single squirrel to be found, and the apprentices head home disappointed.

Slowly, carefully, the young cats enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. Unfortunately, the squirrels are awake, and angry! They hiss and chitter in rage, swiping at their muzzles and driving the apprentices back out of the burrow, where they turn tail and run home.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred as an apprentice by an angry ground squirrel.

intro_text: p_l's patrol strolls through the plains, snow crunching under their paws. r_c raises {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tail, signaling the others to be still; {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} scented ground squirrels nearby.
decline_text: p_l quietly shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head and leads the patrol elsewhere. They'll be tucked away in their burrows, which is... a lot of work for a few thin squirrels.

success_outcomes.text: It's a lot of investigation in the snow, but eventually the patrol finds a burrow with a good amount of sleeping squirrels within. p_l shoves {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} paw in, swiping around until {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} claws hook into fur, and yanks each squirrel out for a r_c to finish off.

It's a lot of investigation in the snow, but eventually the patrol finds a burrow with a good amount of sleeping squirrels within. This burrow has a back exit; r_c sticks {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} muzzle in it and starts yowling down the burrow, waking the squirrels and flushing them out the front, where rest of the patrol awaits with unsheathed claws.

s_c swiftly follows the scent to its origin; a burrow of hibernating squirrels, of course. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/think/thinks} for a short time, then {VERB/s_c/direct/directs} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} Clanmates into different positions, before walking on top of the burrow and slamming {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} paws down repeatedly. That wakes the squirrels, who rush out and right into the waiting paws of the patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: They search as hard as they can, but can never quite seem to find where the squirrels are hiding. Oh well.

intro_text: r_c catches scent of a mouse nearby. But there aren't any footprints imprinted on top of the snow to follow.
decline_text: r_c dismisses the scent and moves on.

success_outcomes.text: r_c sniffs carefully - no, the scent is definitely here. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/creep/creeps} round the edge of the snowdrift, {VERB/r_c/spot/spots} a little burrow entrance, and {VERB/r_c/settle/settles} down to wait. When {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/pad/pads} back into camp, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} cold and stiff - but with mice to add to the fresh-kill pile.

Carefully, r_c waits. Something skitters under the snow. Pinpointing the location of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} prey, r_c leaps high and dives, paws first, into the snowdrift. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/purr/purrs} in satisfaction as prey-blood hits {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} tongue.
s_c immediately drops into a practiced crouch, shimmying flawlessly along the ground, and takes the perfectly plump mouse by surprise, snatching it before it can retreat into its under-snow burrow.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c can't seem to follow the scent trail and decides to hunt easier prey instead.

intro_text: app1 catches scent of a mouse nearby. But {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/lash/lashes} {PRONOUN/app1/poss} tail, confused - everything is covered in snow, where could the prey be?
decline_text: app1 is too irritated to follow the scent.

success_outcomes.text: Hold on - the mouse must be under the snow, not on top of it. app1 patiently waits for a sound, listening to the near silence of a snow-covered world, however something underpaw starts to skitter close by. Pouncing blindly forward, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/sink/sinks} into the snow well over {PRONOUN/app1/poss} head - but {PRONOUN/app1/subject} can feel prey in {PRONOUN/app1/poss} paws!

fail_outcomes.text: Confused and crestfallen, app1 wanders back to camp.

It's under the snow! Flush with enthusiasm, app1 digs at the snowbank, spraying white powder everywhere. But the mouse is long gone before {PRONOUN/app1/subject} can dig down to it, escaped off into another series of tunnels.

It's under the snow! Flush with enthusiasm, app1 digs at the snowbank, spraying white powder everywhere. But the mouse is long gone before {PRONOUN/app1/subject} can dig down to it, escaped off into another series of tunnels, and app1 shivers as {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/pad/pads} back to camp.

history_text.reg_death: m_c perished after being frostbitten on patrol.
history_text.lead_death: couldn't recover after freezing on patrol
history_text.scar: m_c was frostbitten as an apprentice while hunting.

intro_text: app1 catches scent of a mouse nearby. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} confused, asking where it could be, given there aren't footprints in the snow, until p_l indicates the snowdrift itself with a wave of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail.
decline_text: p_l suggests they hunt easier prey.

success_outcomes.text: Oh. This is what those lessons with the high hunting pounce were for. app1 positions {PRONOUN/app1/self} and launches up, falling ungainly on top of the snowdrift and burying {PRONOUN/app1/self} in cold white fluff. Fox-dung! But p_l approaches {PRONOUN/app1/object} afterwards with a commiserating purr. Even though app1 missed {PRONOUN/app1/poss} mouse, the commotion was enough to startle another into p_l's paws, so they don't return home without any prey.

Oh. This is what those lessons with the high hunting pounce were for. app1 positions {PRONOUN/app1/self} and launches up, diving gracefully into the snow. After a heartbeat, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/pop/pops} back up, sending a flurry of snow everywhere and laughing excitedly - {PRONOUN/app1/subject} can feel a mouse pinned under {PRONOUN/app1/poss} paws!

fail_outcomes.text: app1 tries to dive for the mouse in the snow, but the only thing {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/catch/catches} under {PRONOUN/app1/poss} claws is a pebble. p_l curls around {PRONOUN/app1/object} to warm {PRONOUN/app1/object} up afterwards, instructing {PRONOUN/app1/object} on the delicate art of pouncing for prey you can't see.

intro_text: The patrol heads out at sunhigh, trying to press the weak warmth of the sun into their pelts. p_l is a little irritated to see that app1 is more focused on app2 than the challenge of hunting during leaf-bare.
decline_text: The cats are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: While p_l was right - app1 definitely cares more about how {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/look/looks} to app2 than hunting - it turns out fine. The patrol picks up a good haul of mice that were out trying to navigate the recent snowfalls, and p_l indulgently tells app1 {PRONOUN/app1/poss} reaction speed was very good within earshot of app2.

While the way app1 tries to burst out of a bush on a rabbit is categorically silly, the mice that are startled into the claws of the rest of the hunting patrol make up for it, and all the adults remember being young, dumb, and stupid with the desire to impress a pretty pelt. p_l takes app1 aside for a quiet word about toning it down a little, but the hunting trip goes well.

There is a time and a place for app1 to try {PRONOUN/app1/poss} luck looking good in front of app2 - and that time is now! {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/trot/trots} back to camp at the front of the hunting patrol, carrying the mice {PRONOUN/app1/subject} caught with slightly more than the right amount of pride.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 is so busy watching if app2 is watching {PRONOUN/app1/object} that {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/forget/forgets} to watch {PRONOUN/app1/poss} own paws - and falling into the cold river impressed nobody.

intro_text: r_c suggests the patrol hunts close to home - there's no use exhausting themselves pushing through the high snowdrifts.
decline_text: The cats are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: As they arrive, the patrol startles two mice, and r_c reacts quick enough to kill one with an inelegant pounce. It's a good omen for the rest of the morning's work, which proves to be a productive and satisfying hunt.

It's worth it to reserve their strength during leaf-bare, and the hunting grounds near camp are still good enough. They bring the mice they find back to the fresh-kill pile, all pleased with their contributions.

These are the times that it really pays to have a hunter of s_c's caliber on the patrol - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} really {VERB/s_c/go/goes} above and beyond, impressing everyone and leaving a trail of terror among the local mice.

fail_outcomes.text: Ah. r_c's suggested hunting grounds don't work out, not that anyone blames {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for it.

intro_text: Leaf-bare is taking its toll. The patrol is cold, frustrated, and most of all, hungry. p_l notices something odd. Is that a fox in the distance? Why is it jumping into the snow like that?
decline_text: First the cold, and the snow, and now a fox? This is too much for one day, p_l decides. Back to camp, another patrol can try again later.

success_outcomes.text: s_c watches, copying how the fox walks close to the snow, ears down, imagining what it might be listening for until- that's it! s_c leaps into the air, diving headfirst into the snow. The patrol snickers as {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} rear flails above the snow, but that snickering turns to praise when s_c pops back up with a fat mouse hanging from {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} jaws.

The whole patrol stares at the sight of a fox, something cats fear, stuck upside down with its whole rump flailing up and undignified. r_c can't stop {PRONOUN/r_c/self} from snorting at the sight. Then the whole patrol is laughing. For this one moment, the cats forget about the cold in the fur and hunger in their bellies to enjoy a moment with their friends.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c snarls. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/are/is} too cold and too hungry to watch a stupid fox. This will be a hard hunt, r_c snaps, and if the others can't focus, then they should go huddle with the kits at camp.
